title: Bihar employment scheme: CM Nitish Kumar transfers ₹2,500 crore to 25 lakh women
content: State Government, so far, transferred ₹18,100 crore to bank accounts of 1.81 crore women beneficiaries under the scheme

title: Shivamogga airport to get night landing facility by October, says KSIIDC Chairperson
content: The night landing facility had been delayed because it requires sensitive technical elements in addition to electrical work

title: Kerala tourism hits record high in 2025, footfall touches 2.58 crore
content: Among the districts, Idukki recorded the highest number of domestic tourist arrivals at 46,79,800, followed by Ernakulam (44,29,899), Thiruvananthapuram (43,75,846), Thrissur (31,24,696), Wayanad (14,73,710), and Kozhikode (14,69,253), says Kerala Tourism Minister

title: PM Modi to meet French President Macron in Mumbai; to review India-France strategic ties
content: PM Modi and President Macron's discussions will focus on cementing the strategic ties and further diversifying them into new and emerging areas

title: BJP to head a Municipal Corporation for first time in Telangana
content: BJP won a Mayor post for the first time in erstwhile united Andhra Pradesh in 1981, when NSN Reddy became Mayor of Visakhapatnam

title: Mani Shankar Aiyar says remarks on Kerala CM ‘blown out of proportion’
content: Senior Congress leader says the comment was just ‘half a line’ in his speech and that it was exaggerated

title: Wholesale price inflation rises to 1.81% in Jan
content: According to WPI data, inflation in food articles was 1.55% in January as against deflation of 0.43% in December

title: Supreme Court finds ‘no good reason’ to entertain pleas for ‘hate speech’ FIR against Assam CM
content: A three-judge Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant asked the petitioners to approach the State High Court despite the petitioners pointing out that Himanta Biswa Sarma is the “boss of Assam”

title: Trisha condemns ‘distasteful remark’ after Tamil Nadu BJP leader Nainar Nagenthran’s comment draws ire
content: The actor’s statement comes just days after BJP politician Nainar Nagenthran made a crass remark about Trisha and actor and TVK chief Vijay

title: Angry over delay in formation of separate Dharwad city corporation, leaders warn of another agitation
content: According to members of the forum, officers state that the process of carving out a separate municipal corporation for Dharwad is now in the final stage

title: Will Karimnagar get a BJP mayor? All eyes on Mayoral election today
content: Kolagani Srinivas and Y. Sunil Rao are BJP’s candidates for Mayor and Deputy Mayor post of Karimnagar Municipal Corporation

title: Telangana Municipal Chairpersons elected, Councillors and Corporators sworn in
content: Winners contesting from 116 municipalities in Telangana elections are set to take part in the swearing-in ceremony on Monday (February 16, 2026)

title: Sivaratri: Devotees throng Aluva Manappuram in Kerala for rituals
content: Thousands perform ‘bali tharpanam’ (paying obeisance to ancestors) on banks of Periyar river at Aluva as part of Sivaratri on Monday morning

title: Congress distances itself from Mani Shankar Aiyar’s ‘Vijayan next Kerala CM’ remarks
content: Congress asserted that the people of Kerala will bring the United Democratic Front (UDF) back in power in the southern state for more responsible and responsive governance

title: Tamil Nadu Economic Survey says trillion-dollar economy achievable at current growth rate
content: “With 3.5% short term rate of rise of dollar value, it may be delayed for a year,” said the Survey prepared by the State Planning Commission

title: BLO injured in attack by villager in West Bengal's Nadia
content: The injured BLO was taken for medical attention, and several stitches had to be performed on his head

title: Bill Gates arrives on brief visit to Andhra Pradesh
content: Ministers Nara Lokesh, Vangalapudi Anitha, K. Archannaidu and Y. Satya Kumar welcomed Bill Gates at the Vijayawada international airport

title: Cancer patients & pregnancy: Bengaluru scientists explore way to save eggs lost inside the ovary
content: If successful, the approach in the later stage could help preserve fertility in cancer patients by safeguarding eggs before treatment damages the ovaries

title: Seven workers killed in chemical factory fire in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi, two trapped inside
content: The fire broke out in Bhiwadi's Khushkhera-Karoli industrial area; additional District Magistrate Sumita Mishra said police came to know about the incident during a routine patrol

title: Bill Gates all praise for adoption of latest technologies in A.P. governance
content: Bill Gates appreciated the streamlining of citizen services through Data Lake and WhatsApp Governance, and called the efforts going into the development of the capital city as ‘great work’

title: SC's nine-judge Bench to decide if sovereign functions, state activities come under 'industry'
content: The reference is based on a 1978 seven-judge Bench 'pro-labour' judgment delivered by Justice V.R. Krishna Iyer

title: Higher conviction in cases after full implementation of new criminal laws: Home Minister Shah
content: The three new justice-based criminal laws are one of the milestones achieved by the country in the last 11 years, he said

title: Crime Branch questions Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil in rape case
content: Rahul Mamkootathil presents himself before investigating officer G. Poonguzhali at State Police Club in Thiruvananthapuram for interrogation

title: Former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah resigns from party ahead of Assembly polls
content: Sources said Bhupen Kumar Borah has sent his resignation letter to Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge

title: Older than London’s Big Ben, Palayamkottai’s historic clock is set to chime again
content: “Big Ben was installed in 1859, whereas this clock was manufactured in 1854 and installed in 1855. It was made by John Moore & Sons of Clerkenwell, a renowned London-based clockmaker,” said antique clock collector Robert Kennedy

title: Meghalaya Budget Session: State on track to triple its economy by 2032, says Governor Vijayashankar
content: In his inaugural address, Meghalaya Governor Vijayashankar also pointed to a 9.66% real GSDP growth and sustained post-pandemic expansion

title: Sabarimala women entry: Supreme Court’s 9-judge Constitution Bench to begin review hearing from April 7
content: Chief Justice Kant said the original nine-judge Bench hearing was interrupted by the onset of the pandemic; ruminates that he is the only serving judge from that Bench

title: Rahul Gandhi uninterested in Parliament; ‘tutored by NGOs’ on revival of Congress: Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also said that the government is not going to take any more extra steps to "placate" the Congress to defuse the situation in Parliament

title: SIR in West Bengal: ECI suspends 7 officials for serious misconduct and misuse of statutory powers
content: The Election Commission directed the State’s Chief Secretary to initiate disciplinary proceedings against them

title: Declining areca yield, lack of amenities forcing residents of village surrounded by Kudremukh National Park in Karnataka to move out
content: As the village is interspersed with a national park, which is a protected area, the government hardly takes up any development work in the village

title: Come pepper harvest season, children of migrant workers in Karnataka miss school
content: While parents harvest pepper to earn a decent pay, their children spend days taking care of their younger siblings in tents

title: Why fewer youths from Punjab are joining the armed forces | The Hindu Spotlight
content: As fewer youths from Punjab join the armed forces, the residents of Nathowal, known locally as ‘faujian da pind’ (village of soldiers) in Ludhiana district, lay out the reasons. Agnipath’s uncertainty, drug fears, and the lure of foreign earnings, are pushing parents to send children away from home, creating a generation that’s dreaming beyond regimental traditions

title: India AI Summit 2026 LIVE: AI-generated misinformation has power to derail democracies, says Union Minister
content: Global tech leaders, including Sundar Pichai and Sam Altman, along with representatives from around 20 countries, are expected at the AI Impact Summit

title: How much money is collected every year through FASTag at toll booths in Karnataka?
content: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari said that Electronic Toll Collection (ETC) now accounts for more than 98% of user fee collection across the country, including Karnataka

title: Rupee slips 1 paisa to 90.67 against U.S. dollar in early session
content: A marginal rise in global crude oil prices and a sharp decline in the country's forex reserves also weighed on the local unit, according to forex traders

title: 'I am not a Rahulian': Congress rift blows up as Mani Shankar Aiyar goes on name-calling spree
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar invoked B.R. Ambedkar after the Congress distanced itself from his praise of Kerala's Pinarayi Vijayan government. Aiyar criticized Rahul Gandhi and Pawan Khera, calling Khera a "puppet" and "parrot." He expressed contempt for Khera and questioned the party's handling of dissent, contrasting it with Nehru's era.

title: Rajpal Yadav gets relief: Delhi HC grants interim bail in cheque bounce case
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court in cheque bounce cases after depositing Rs 1.5 crore. The court suspended his sentence, allowing him to remain out of custody until March 18, with conditions including a personal bond and surety. His wife expressed gratitude for industry support amidst speculation about debt repayment.

title: Russia rejects Alexei Navalny poisoning charge, 'naturally'
content: Russia has dismissed European accusations of poisoning Alexei Navalny as "biased and baseless." European nations, including Britain and Germany, believe Navalny was poisoned with epibatidine. The US stated it is not disputing the charge, which comes after Navalny's death in February 2024 at an Arctic penal colony.

title: Meet Team India's silent assassin who killed Pakistan's chase
content: Axar Patel's intelligent bowling, particularly his variations in length, proved crucial in India's T20 World Cup victory over Pakistan. His dismissal of Usman Khan and Babar Azam stifled Pakistan's chase. Patel, a flexible all-rounder, prioritizes team needs over batting order, showcasing adaptability both with ball and bat.

title: 'Shooting' video row: SC refuses to hear pleas against Assam CM; flags ‘disturbing trend’
content: The Supreme Court declined to hear pleas for an FIR and SIT probe against Himanta Biswa Sarma concerning a controversial video, directing petitioners to the Gauhati High Court. Justices questioned the bypass of lower courts, deeming it an "undermining" of their authority and a concerning election-eve trend. The bench urged constitutional restraint.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott on her inspiration for huge donations
content: MacKenzie Scott attributes her philanthropic approach to early acts of kindness, recalling a college roommate's loan and a dentist's free care. Since 2020, she has donated approximately 58 million Amazon shares, totaling billions through her Yield Giving organization, which supports diverse causes like education and DEI.

title: T20 World Cup: Steve Smith added to Australia squad
content: Steve Smith has been drafted into Australia's T20 World Cup squad, replacing Josh Hazlewood and is likely to open against Sri Lanka. This move comes as captain Mitchell Marsh remains doubtful due to injury, with Smith's inclusion bolstering a squad already missing key pacers and dealing with other player concerns.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: Swipe, match, murder: How dating apps became hunting grounds for blackmailers and killers
content: Dating apps, promising connection, have become a breeding ground for crime. From extortion and blackmail to murder, criminals exploit fake profiles and emotional manipulation. Cases across India reveal a disturbing pattern of predators using technology and fear to target unsuspecting users, leading to devastating consequences.

title: Land-for-job CBI case: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu Prasad, Rabri Devi
content: A Delhi court has formally framed charges against former Railway Minister Lalu Prasad and ex-Bihar CM Rabri Devi in the Land-for-Job CBI case. The couple denied the charges and will face trial for allegedly providing Railway Group D jobs in exchange for land.

title: Radio show host David Greene claims Google stole his voice; it responds
content: Radio host David Greene is suing Google, claiming the tech giant 'stole' his voice for its AI-powered NotebookLM tool. Greene alleges the AI's voice is so similar to his own that listeners and colleagues mistook it for him. Google denies the allegations, stating the voice is from a paid professional actor.

title: RERA under fire from SC: Why are RERA annual reports important to protect interests of homebuyers?
content: A homebuyer advocacy group has alleged that several state regulators have failed to publish the annual reports mandated under the law. Has RERA improved project delivery? What are RERA reports and why are they important for protecting homebuyers? We take a look:

title: ‘Darkest period in our history’: Yousuf lashes out after India humiliate Pakistan
content: Following India's dominant 61-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup in Colombo, former great Mohammad Yousuf has voiced extreme disappointment, calling it the "darkest period in our cricketing history." He criticised the team's performance and called for the removal of incompetent individuals and political influence from Pakistan cricket.

title: Andhra men force vendor to eat his 'kova bun' over 'food jihad' suspicion
content: Shaik Shaiksha Vali, a Muslim vendor, received significant financial and political backing. He was allegedly harassed by YouTubers at the Medaram Jatara. Ministers and party leaders condemned the incident. The Minority Rights Protection Committee provided financial aid. Vali thanked his supporters. Authorities have not yet released a statement on action against those involved.

title: Rajasthan factory blaze: 8 burnt alive in blast at illegal firecracker factory in Bhiwadi
content: At least eight workers were killed and two more feared trapped in a massive fire at an illegal firecracker factory in Rajasthan's Alwar district. The blaze, fueled by a large stock of gunpowder and cardboard, erupted after several explosions, causing panic and leading to the evacuation of nearby factories. Firefighters battled for hours to control the inferno.

title: Rajpal Yadav plea hearing: HC gives time till 3pm to pay Rs 1.5 cr for bail
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court, with the condition to pay Rs 1.5 crore by 3 pm today. His wife expressed gratitude for the industry's support amidst his legal troubles concerning cheque bounce cases.

title: PAN quoting changes: Cash, property transaction limits revised; top points
content: Draft Income Tax Rules 2026: Under the proposed framework, the threshold limits for several transactions requiring PAN Card details to be disclosed have undergone a change.

title: Blast, flames, screams and deaths: Man, his mother die while preparing 'bombs'; video surfaces
content: A rooftop bomb-making operation in Bhubaneswar tragically ended in an explosion, claiming two lives including a history-sheeter and his mother. The blast, which injured two others, prompted a preliminary inquiry by the NIA, which ruled out terror links but is investigating a potential larger conspiracy. Forensic findings suggest the use of high explosives.

title: 'Biggest crime in the world': Shoaib Akhtar slams PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, Pakistan
content: Shoaib Akhtar slammed PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi and Babar Azam after Pakistan’s 61-run loss to India, calling the leadership “incompetent” and questioning Babar’s match-winning ability. He said Pakistan lacks investment and modern talent to compete with India. In the match, India made 175/7 and bowled Pakistan out for 114, with early wickets triggering a collapse despite Usman Khan’s 44.

title: ‘He took the game away’: Mike Hesson admits fearless Ishan Kishan broke Pakistan
content: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson conceded a brilliant 77 by Ishan Kishan was the turning point in their T20 World Cup loss to India. Kishan's fearless batting dismantled Pakistan's spin strategy on a difficult pitch, setting India on course for victory. Hesson acknowledged his team was outplayed and now faces pressure to regroup for crucial upcoming matches.

title: 'Concerns wrong': Why Nasscom president is not worried about AI taking tech jobs
content: Rajesh Nambiar, President of Nasscom, addressed concerns about AI displacing tech jobs, emphasising that intricate business demands and regulatory frameworks will ensure the ongoing necessity of IT services. He envisions a future where the industry evolves through AI orchestration, building on profound enterprise expertise. Furthermore, he highlights that India's skilled workforce is well-positioned to thrive in this transformative era.

title: ‘Was playing near temple’: 3-year-old dies after falling into water-filled pit in Greater Noida
content: A three-year-old boy tragically lost his life after falling into a water-filled pit in Dallelgarh village, Greater Noida. The incident has angered villagers who allege negligence by the local authority. The child, Devansh, fell into the pit while playing near a temple. Despite rescue efforts, he could not be saved.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,450; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: After deep cuts towards the end of last week, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was below 25,450, BSE Sensex dropped over 100 points in opening trade.

title: Rajpal Yadav bail hearing: Sonu Sood prays for positive outcome in 9 cr check bounce case
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav is currently in Tihar Jail over a Rs 9 crore check bounce case. Following his surrender due to financial inability, actor Sonu Sood has publicly supported him. The Delhi High Court is set to hear Yadav's bail plea today, which he filed to attend his niece's wedding. Sood expressed hope for a positive verdict.

title: T20 World Cup: India into Super 8s after thrashing Pakistan — who's next?
content: India beat Pakistan by 61 runs to qualify for the T20 World Cup Super 8s, with Ishan Kishan’s 77 powering them to 175/7 before Pakistan were bowled out for 114. Suryakumar Yadav praised Kishan and said batting first was the right call. Pakistan collapsed early despite Usman Khan’s 44. India now join West Indies in the next round and will face South Africa, one of Zimbabwe or Australia, and West Indies.

title: Human musculoskeletal system wasn’t built for chair life: Doctor warns
content: Modern desk jobs have normalized prolonged sitting, leading to musculoskeletal issues in young adults.  The human body, evolved for frequent movement, now experiences hip flexor tightness, back pain, and neck strain due to sustained postures.  These issues, once seen in older individuals, are now prevalent in those in their twenties and thirties.

title: India vs Pakistan: Which cricketers own better car collection?
content: Cricketers from India and Pakistan showcase impressive car collections. Indian stars like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Hardik Pandya favor luxury SUVs and supercars. Pakistani players such as Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi also own premium vehicles, including Audis and Toyotas. Their garages highlight a shared passion for automobiles, albeit with varied preferences and price points.

title: Sabarimala case: 9-judge SC bench to hear pleas on discrimination against women at religious places
content: A nine-judge Supreme Court bench will hear pleas concerning women's religious entry rights, including the Sabarimala Temple case, starting April 7, 2026. The court will examine the intersection of essential religious practices, equality, and constitutional morality across various faiths. This hearing follows a 2018 ruling that permitted women of all ages into the Sabarimala temple.

title: ‘We don’t see rivalry’: Axar Patel’s cold verdict after India thrash Pakistan
content: India secured a dominant 61-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, showcasing a composed mindset and exceptional skill. Vice-captain Axar Patel emphasised the team's focus on cricket over rivalry. Ishan Kishan's sensational 77 off 40 balls on a challenging pitch laid the foundation for India's win, extending their World Cup dominance over Pakistan.

title: 'Why is it not paying tax?': Priyank Kharge levels ‘money laundering racket’ charge against RSS
content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge has accused the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh of engaging in money laundering and questioned its sources of income. He demanded that the RSS, an unregistered organization, be held accountable and pay taxes like other citizens and entities under the law and Constitution.

title: Absence of saptapadi alone cannot invalidate marriage: What Delhi HC said on a Hindu marriage
content: Referring to established jurisprudence, including precedent from the Bombay High Court, the Bench emphasized the legal principle that long cohabitation and societal recognition reinforce presumptions of lawful marriage.

title: What's the outlook for Nifty for this week? Check list of top recommendations
content: Stock market recommendations: Arvind, and Bajaj Finance are the top stock picks by Sudeep Shah, Head - Technical Research and Derivatives, SBI Securities for the week starting February 16, 2026. He also shares his views and outlook on Nifty, Bank Nifty:

title: Why school bus commutes in the UAE are raising health and learning concerns
content: The UAE has introduced new limits for school bus journeys, capping travel at 45 minutes for young children and 60 minutes for older students. This move addresses concerns about long commutes impacting children's health, sleep and academic focus. Global research highlights physical discomfort, air pollution exposure and mental stress as key issues linked to extended travel times.

title: Gold price prediction: Is gold set to exhibit a bullish bias? Top factors to watch out for
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have pulled back from recent highs, but there is an underlying bullish bias, says Manav Modi, Senior Analyst, Commodity Research at Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd. Below is his outlook for gold prices today and this week, along with top factors that will influence the movement of the yellow metal:

title: Watch: Pandya lashes out at Kuldeep during India's win over Pakistan
content: India’s 61-run win over Pakistan secured Super Eights qualification and featured a viral on-field moment as Hardik Pandya angrily reacted to dropped catches by Kuldeep Yadav and Ishan Kishan. Pandya later struck back with the ball, finishing with 2 wickets as Pakistan were bowled out for 114. Ishan Kishan’s 77 powered India to 175/7, while Pakistan collapsed early despite Usman Khan’s 44.

title: First-of-its-kind mission: US airlifts next-gen nuclear reactor on C-17 aircraft
content: The United States successfully airlifted a miniature nuclear reactor for the first time using a C-17 Globemaster III aircraft as part of Operation Windlord. This marks a significant step in rapidly deployable nuclear energy systems, aiming to enhance energy security for military bases and strengthen national security.

title: 'Delhi declaration' may be adopted at AI summit in Delhi
content: India has launched its first comprehensive AI governance guidelines, opting for a flexible, principle-based approach to foster innovation while managing risks.  These seven 'sutras' emphasize trust, people-first development, fairness, and accountability.  The framework relies on existing laws and proposes new institutions to oversee AI, aiming to position India as a leader in responsible AI development.

title: How Pakistan can crash out of T20 World Cup after India defeat
content: Pakistan’s 61-run loss to India has put their T20 World Cup hopes at risk, with elimination possible depending on final Group A results. India have qualified for the Super Eights, while Pakistan sit third. Ishan Kishan’s 77 powered India to 175, before Pakistan collapsed for 114. Pakistan must beat Namibia to qualify for THE Super 8s.

title: I am an SC woman. Will my caste change if I marry a general category person? HC explains
content: The Allahabad High Court has ruled that caste is determined by birth and does not change with conversion or marriage. This landmark decision came while dismissing an appeal challenging a lower court's order to try nine individuals under the SC/ST Act. The court emphasized that inter-caste marriage does not alter a person's caste identity, reinforcing protections against atrocities.

title: Residents flag health risks over Organic Waste Converter construction at Godrej Eternity in Bengaluru
content: They claim that operating an Organic Waste Converter in close proximity to apartments will have an adverse impact on residents

title: India stands at forefront of AI transformation: PM Modi
content: PM Modi pointed out that AI today is transforming several sectors, including healthcare, education, agriculture, governance and enterprise

title: SC-ST dilemma: Karnataka’s Rohith Vemula Act against caste bias on college campus stuck in red tape
content: The debate on the proposed law has again come to the forefront after the Supreme Court of India stayed the UGC (Promotion of Equity in Higher Education Institutions) Regulations 2026, followed by agitations both for and against the regulations

title: India's first ‘cow culture’ museum to open in U.P.'s Mathura
content: The museum will convey the “religious, cultural, and spiritual significance of cattle, as well as the scientific utility of cows and their products”

title: E-application for Agniveer recruitment in Telangana opens
content: Applications are being invited from candidates domiciled in all 33 districts of Telangana that fall under the jurisdiction of the Army Recruiting Office, Secunderabad

title: AI Impact Summit: U.K. Deputy PM calls Delhi summit ‘important moment' to unlock full benefits of AI
content: During the AI Impact Summit this week, the U.K. is expected to announce new support for an African Language Hub, enabling AI to work in 40 African languages

title: Centre approves road projects worth over ₹11,000 crore in Maharashtra, Gujarat and Telangana
content: Approved by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, these projects seek to improve freight movement, reduce travel time and enhance connectivity

title: Health department team deployed in Haryana village after 4 deaths due to hepatitis B
content: More than 400 people have been screened for symptoms in Chhainsa village in Hathin sub-division in Palwal district, officials said

title: An olive green recession
content: As fewer youths from Punjab join the armed forces, the residents of Nathowal, known locally as ‘faujian da pind’ (village of soldiers) in Ludhiana district, lay out the reasons. They tell Vikas Vasudeva that Agnipath’s uncertainty, drug fears, and the lure of foreign earnings, are pushing parents to send children away from home, creating a generation that’s dreaming beyond regimental traditions

title: Most professors of practice hired in Tamil Nadu followed by Maharashtra, Gujarat: UGC Data
content: According to the data, 1,841 PoPs have been hired by 349 HEIs so far, the maximum of them being in Tamil Nadu (395); while 193 PoPs have been hired in Maharashtra (193), Gujarat and Karnataka have appointed 179 and 170 professionals, respectively

title: Traffic woes to ease as at Madhya Kailash as Stalin opens flyover
content: The flyover will allow vehicles proceeding to Rajiv Gandhi Salai from Guindy to turn right, avoiding the traffic signal

title: NC, PDP slam BJP MP for spending 94% MPLAD funds in Uttar Pradesh
content: Leaders of National Conference and Peoples Democratic Party alleged that Jammu and Kashmir’s representation had been reduced to symbolism, with its people denied their rightful share of resources

title: Assault on workers while transporting cattle in Kasaragod: four held
content: They were taken into custody by Manjeswaram police inspector and his team following an intensive probe launched after the incident triggered controversy

title: Imbichi Bava hospital holds mini marathon
content: About 3,000 members of various organisations and clubs, along with students and trauma care teams, took part in the marathon, which concluded at Alathiyur

title: Cotton farmers oppose Goyal’s U.S. import remarks, warn of price crash
content: Farm bodies say zero-tariff raw cotton import from the U.S. will severely affect domestic price and devastate growers; several farmer bodies, particularly those working among cotton farmers, have decided to launch protests

title: 40 lakh devotees take holy dip in Ganga, Sangam on Magh Mela’s last day
content: The Magh Mela also remained in the news amid tensions between Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and the administration

title: Assam school students’ drive for urban bird nest conservation spreads wings
content: The Chorai Bandhob initiative of the children of Bongaon Chola High School expands to several institutions, promoting urban nesting spaces ahead of breeding season.

title: Debris of rockets with ISRO logo found near uninhabited island in Maldives
content: The debris of the Payload Fairing which are believed to be that of ISRO’s Launch Vehicle Mark-3 (LVM-3) washed up to an island near L. Kunahandhoo in Maldives

title: Watch: Mulund Metro accident: Five arrested, Rs 5 crore fine on contractor
content: Five people have been arrested following the fatal slab collapse at an under-construction metro site in Mumbai’s Mulund area on February 14, which killed one person and injured three.

title: Restricted access to AI summit on Day 1; expo to open for all from February 17
content: The expo will include pavilions from Australia, Japan, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Serbia, Estonia, Tajikistan, and Africa

title: Opposition slams PM Modi for ‘hollow words’ in ‘scripted’ interview
content: Opposition says Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s interview means “little in reality” and is an attempt to divert attention from a “damp squib” Budget and capitulation before the U.S.

title: We bore the blame for your mistakes, Congress MP Manickam Tagore tells DMK
content: In remarks made at a meeting of the District Congress Committee in Madurai, Mr. Tagore was indirectly referring to the corruption allegations against the DMK that resulted in the decimation of the United Progressive Alliance in the 2014 Lok Sabha election

title: Friend recalls his final conversation with Saketh; says he ate and engaged less over last two weeks
content: Sharing the news with grief, the friend, who requested privacy on LinkedIn in another post, says the revelation has shocked the entire community

title: Tipu Sultan row: FIR against Maharashtra Congress chief; stone throwing in Pune
content: The BJP protested in Pune as well as Mumbai by putting black ink on photographs of Congress leader Harshvardhan Sapkal and burning his effigies

title: Kerala can contribute to strengthening secularism: Amartya Sen
content: Joining Vision 2031 meet online, Prof. Sen draws attention to the State’s historical openness to the world at large. Historian Romila Thapar commends strides made by Kerala in literacy and education

title: India has entered recent trade agreements from a position of strength: PM Modi
content: Beyond tariffs, FTAs will reduce non-tariff barriers and expand global market access for Indian MSMEs, says PM; urges private sector to step up and take advantage of enabling policy framework

title: Vallalar’s birth anniversary will be celebrated for three days every year, says M.K. Stalin
content: The Chief Minister also announces the establishment of a research centre on the saint in Chennai. It will come up at the HR&CE Department headquarters in Nungambakkam

title: Maharashtra ATS conducts searches in two districts
content: Raids were conducted in Umarkhed and Pusad in Yavatmal over the suspicion that certain individuals were in contact with terrorist organisations, radicalising youths

title: Watch: MeitY: India hosts AI Impact Summit to democratise technology for Global South
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) said India’s AI Impact Summit will focus on democratising artificial intelligence for the Global South. The summit aims to ensure that AI development is inclusive and accessible, particularly for developing nations.

title: Across West Bengal, youth line up to apply for unemployment aid
content: Scheme offers monthly ₹1,500 to unemployed 21-to-40-year olds who are not prior beneficiaries of any government social welfare scheme; payouts likely before Assembly election, offering Trinamool a critical poll campaign plank

title: Hope for India-Bangladesh ties in Tarique Rahman’s development pitch: diplomatic sources
content: The Indian side keenly watched the campaign trail of Rahman and found that his 31-point agenda has several areas such as his plans in digital domain and infrastructure building that may help improvement in ties

title: Six from Haryana held for cheating in GATE
content: The police received information that certain individuals planned to cheat by providing unfair assistance to candidates through electronic devices

title: INDO-PACOM Chief praises Operation Sindoor, calls for vigilance, deeper India-U.S. defence cooperation
content: Remarks highlight Operation Sindoor, India-U.S. defence cooperation, vigilance, and Indo-Pacific security

title: Special pujas mark Mahashivaratri celebrations across NK region
content: Jatra draws huge crowds in Hubballi, while in Belagavi, long queues of devotees were found outside temples

title: Kerala setting newer models for the world, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Inaugurating the three-day international conference Vision 2031, CM says the coming five years offer the State an opportunity to bring together growth and justice, technology and humanity, modernisation and sustainability.

title: Mayoral poll: Battle for control of Karimnagar and Nizamabad municipal corporations poised for a nail-biting finish
content: With the main political parties lacking the requisite majority to clinch the mayoral posts, all eyes are now on the independent candidates whose support has become crucial in determining the mayoral election outcome

title: Concerns persist over SIR despite low number of omissions post hearing, say parties
content: Of the 4,06,366 voters subjected to verification, only 3,058 were found ineligible for inclusion in the final list. However, parties say clarity will emerge only after the final list is published on February 21

title: Edwards, Wemby 'set tone' for competitive ASG
content: Anthony Edwards led Team Stars to a victory in the revamped NBA All-Star Game, earning MVP honors after a refreshingly competitive display by the stars involved.

title: Kansas St. fires Tang after rant, one Big 12 win
content: Jerome Tang, who led Kansas State to the Elite Eight in his first season but has failed to replicate that success in his three seasons since, was fired for cause by the school.

title: Sources: Seahawks to hire 49ers' Fleury as OC
content: The Seahawks are expected to hire 49ers tight ends coach Brian Fleury as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday.

title: Brown refutes Beverly Hills' account of shutdown
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown said the City of Beverly Hills' explanation for shutting down his brand event Saturday night was "completely false."

title: Johnson, ex-Pro Bowl Washington OL, dies at 54
content: Tre' Johnson, the former standout NFL offensive lineman with Washington who went on to become a Maryland high school history teacher, died Sunday. He was 54.

title: U.S. men stay unbeaten; 2-seed for knockouts
content: Auston Matthews scored twice and set up Zach Werenski's goal with a textbook pass, Connor Hellebuyck stopped 23 of the 24 shots he faced, and the U.S. defeated Germany 5-1 on Sunday night to finish group play at the Olympics unbeaten.

title: Reddick races to Daytona win in Jordan-owned car
content: Tyler Reddick won the Daytona 500 in a car owned by Michael Jordan when Chase Elliott crashed as he and Reddick were battling for the win.

title: OU hits 2 slams, scores 34 runs in softball rout
content: No. 4 Oklahoma hit two grand slams in an inning en route to a 34-0 softball rout of UTEP that came within one run of tying the Sooners' record for runs in a game.

title: 🏈 One key offseason question for every NFL team
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: Thanks to a buzzer-beater move befitting of Michael Jordan, Tyler Reddick won the biggest race in NASCAR.

title: Grades, lessons learned and big questions from Team USA's 5-1 win over Germany
content: An American win seemed inevitable, sending the team through to the quarterfinals. Here's what stood out the most.

title: Perfect through three games: Canada grades, takeaways, top players
content: With the blowout win, Canada likely earned top seed for the next round. Here's how it happened, what's next.

title: Women's Bracketology: Finding meaning in the metrics
content: The selection committee's first reveal of the season leaned into head-to-head, but the metric isn't the only answer.

title: LaMelo to DeMar: Which L.A. NBA stars would've made an All-Star roster in high school?
content: From LaMelo Ball to James Harden, these Los Angeles NBA stars' high school résumés would land them on an All-Star roster.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Six players ejected in St. John's-Providence clash
content: Six players were ejected from Saturday's Big East clash between No. 17 St. John's and Providence after a hard foul by Friars forward Duncan Powell on Red Storm star Bryce Hopkins.

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: Fans love a big splash but don't always get one. Here's what some non-moves mean for each team's playoff forecast.

title: Wetzel: A coach's lessons on fatherhood ... from 1948
content: Joe Judge was trying to make a point to help a player get a court injunction. Instead he got a viral moment.

title: Beyond dunking: Mac McClung's quest for full NBA roster status
content: Jumping over cars -- and Shaq -- wins fans but doesn't translate into the talents recruiters want to see

title: Is soccer better without VAR? FA Cup shows nobody really knows
content: Neither the third or fourth rounds of the FA Cup used VAR, yet they produced opposite reactions on whether soccer needs the technology.

title: Why Chelsea's win over Liverpool is a first step into uncharted territory
content: After general manager Paul Green left the club. Chelsea's win over Liverpool was the first step in a new era.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Real Madrid teenager Valdepeñas
content: Real Madrid's Victor Valdepeñas is among Arsenal's favored options as Mikel Arteta aims to further reinforce his back line in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: 7 Workers Dead In Rajasthan Chemical Factory Fire, 10 Feared Trapped
content: Seven workers died in a massive fire at a chemical factory in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi on Monday, while 10 workers are still feared trapped.

title: No Stop To Post-Poll Violence In Bangladesh, 10 Injured, House Set Ablaze
content: At least nine people were injured, and a house was set ablaze amid escalating incidents of post-election violence in five districts across Bangladesh, local media reported.

title: Wife Of Congress' Ali Imran Ramz Accuses Him Of Physical, Financial Abuse
content: Priyanjali Neogi, the wife of former Forward Bloc MLA from Chakulia and current Congress leader Ali Imran Ramz, has levelled serious allegations of physical, mental and financial abuse against him.

title: Pentagon To Get Elon Musk's xAI As Claude Alternative? New Claims Emerge
content: A post about the "safest AI company" on the planet has given insight into an ongoing controversy regarding the use of artificial intelligence by the US military to capture ex-Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

title: US Conducts First Air Transport Of Micro Nuclear Reactor On Cargo Plane
content: The US Departments of Energy and Defense on Sunday for the first time transported a small nuclear reactor on a cargo plane from California to Utah to demonstrate the potential to quickly deploy nuclear power for military and civilian use.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Can Tarique Rahman Really Undo The 'Yunus' Damage To India-Bangladesh Ties?
content: Will Tarique Rahman as Prime Minister be willing to take hard steps, even reverse some decisions of the Yunus regime, looking ahead to ensure peace and stability along the more than 4,000-kilometre-long border between India and Bangladesh?

title: Lalu Yadav Pleads Not Guilty In Land-For-Job Case, Says Will Face Trial
content: RJD chief Lalu Yadav and former Bihar Chief Minister Rabri Devi on Monday pleaded innocence in the alleged Railways land-for-jobs corruption case being probed by the Central Bureau of Investigation and expressed their willingness to face trial

title: 'Fact, Fiction, WhatsApp Forwards Mix': Karti Chidambaram's Dhurandhar Reply
content: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has responded to the uproar over blockbuster Dhurandhar's currency deal scene, which many on social media have linked to him and his father, former Union Minister and Congress veteran P Chidambaram

title: 'Quit For Self-Respect': Bhupen Bora Resigns From Congress After 32 Years
content: Senior Congress leader in Assam, Bhupen Bora, announced that he has resigned from the party, ending his 32-year-long association with the grand old party.

title: UK Brings AI-Focused Diplomacy To India At AI Impact Summit 2026
content: Britain has placed artificial intelligence at the heart of its global diplomacy, with Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy and AI Minister Kanishka Narayan arriving in India this week to lead a high-profile UK delegation to India AI Impact Summit 2026

title: 3 Real Estate Tycoon Brothers Face Sexual Assault Charges From 10 Women
content: Startling revelations have come forward in the sex trafficking trial of Israeli-American real-estate brokers, the Alexander brothers.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Detailed Plan For Five-Day Event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the India AI Impact Summit 2026 at 5 pm today, February 16, at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi.

title: On Camera, Odisha Rooftop Explosion During Suspected Bomb-Making Kills 2
content: An explosion in the Odisha capital Bhubaneswar has left four people critically injured, with two of them later dying during treatment. The blast caused panic in the neighbourhood as residents rushed out of their homes after hearing a loud sound.

title: Delhi Braces For Security, Traffic Curbs As AI Summit Coincides With Board Exams
content: Delhi braces for heightened security deployment and extensive traffic restrictions as the five-day AI Impact Summit begins, with Delhi Police rolling out elaborate arrangements to ensure minimal disruption to students appearing for board exams.

title: India Eyes Big Role In Shaping AI Future With Mega Tech Chiefs Summit
content: India kicks off one of the world's largest artificial intelligence summits Monday, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking to clear a path for India in a heated race to develop frontier models.

title: What Is Chinamaxxing, The Viral Trend Western Internet Stars Are Embracing
content: A social media trend known as Chinamaxxing is gaining traction across Western audiences, with users posting contents how casing Chinese lifestyle habits and wellness routines.

title: Chandrababu Naidu, Bill Gates Meet At Andhra Pradesh Secretariat
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates arrived at the state secretariat, where he was received by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu.

title: 3-Year-Old Drowns In Pond In Greater Noida, Weeks After Techie's Death
content: A three-year-old boy drowned in a pond in Greater Noida, leading villagers to protest civic inaction weeks after a Delhi biker and Noida techie died while awaiting help.

title: 7 Pakistani Soldiers In Custody, Balochistan Army's 7-Day Ultimatum To Islamabad
content: The separatist militant group the Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) has claimed it is holding seven members of Pakistan's security forces in custody and has issued a seven-day deadline to the Pakistani government for a prisoner exchange.
